definition: as the saying goes/as they say...

sentences.english: Like they say, barking dogs don't bite.
sentences.chinese: 常言說的好，會叫的狗不咬人。

sentences.english: After all, as Mr. Bernanke has repeatedly said, the Fed can only do so much.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟正如貝南克常言，美聯儲能做的也就這麼多了。

sentences.english: As the old saying goes, "Spare the stick, spoil the child."
sentences.chinese: 常言道，“省下了棍子，慣壞了孩子”。

sentences.english: People say those, who do not remember their past, do not deserve the future.
sentences.chinese: 常言道，不牢記過去的人，不配擁有未來。

sentences.english: As the old saying goes, if you don't know where you're going, any road can get you there.
sentences.chinese: 常言道，如果你不知道要去哪裏，隨便哪條路都可以。

sentences.english: People often say that, compared with nature, man is insignificant.
sentences.chinese: 常言說，和自然界相比，人類十分渺小。

sentences.english: Revolutions, it is often claimed, do not happen when people are desperate.
sentences.chinese: 常言道，革命不會在人們感到絕望的時候發生。

sentences.english: Butterflies are free, the saying goes.
sentences.chinese: 常言道，蝴蝶是自由自在的。

sentences.english: It is often said, "Human individuals differ from one another. Flowers too."
sentences.chinese: 常言道，“人與人不同，花有幾樣紅。”

sentences.english: That said, aspiring junior sportspeople at school should not despair.
sentences.chinese: 常言說，有抱負的青年運動員在學校裏不應該頹喪。

sentences.english: As the saying goes, good planets are hard to find.
sentences.chinese: 常言道說，找到一個好的星球很難。

sentences.english: The saying goes, a small bear, then the chaos great plans.
sentences.chinese: 常言說，小不忍，則亂大謀。

sentences.english: As "ill come on horseback, but go away on foot."
sentences.chinese: 常言道“病來如山倒，病去如抽絲”。

definition: as they say, .../as the saying goes, ...
as the proverb says/as they say...
lit. human beings will die for riches, just as birds will for food (idiom)/fig. man will do anything in his means to become rich
pinyin: ren2 wei4 cai2 si3 , niao3 wei4 shi2 wang2

definition: lit. the dog that bites does not show its fangs (idiom)/fig. You can't tell the really dangerous enemy from his external appearance.
pinyin: yao3 ren2 gou3 'r bu4 lu4 chi3

definition: Look out for yourself, or heaven and earth will combine to destroy you./Every man for himself, and the Devil take the hindmost.
pinyin: ren2 bu4 wei4 ji3 , tian1 zhu1 di4 mie4

definition: if it's plowing, ask the laborer (idiom); when managing a matter, consult the appropriate specialist
lit. it is not an official to be feared, but a person in direct control over sb (proverb)/fig. to be obliged to comply with people in authority
pinyin: bu4 pa4 guan1 , zhi3 pa4 guan3

definition: virtue has its reward, evil its retribution
pinyin: shan4 you3 shan4 bao4 , e4 you3 e4 bao4
